page.title: 09OUR SCHOOL-CAMERTON PRIMARY
page.content: Built in 1867, it is stone with a slate roof consisting of two classrooms, a hall, a library and an office. There are 23 junior and 22 infant children. The staff consist of a Headmistress, an infant teacher, a part time teacher, a secretary and 3 dinner ladies. It is a Church of England school and the Rector takes the Friday service. It is customary once a term for all to walk to church. The school is on a hill next to a dangerous bend. There is a tarmac playground with a climbing frame, a grassed area with a chestnut and willow tree and a pond in a conservation area.
